title: Introducing Twitter Polls: Now create and cast your vote privately on Twitter polls
text:
Introducing Twitter Polls: Now create and cast your vote privately on Twitter polls By Priya Prakashan on October 23, 2015 at 9:27 PM Comments 
Now, you can cast you vote and have your say for every big question on the popular social networking website Twitter. Introducing Twitter polls, where all you opinions count. You can vote privately on Twitter polls. Everyone on Twitter will be able to come up with public polls soon on the micro blogging site. The polls on Twitter can be on any topics they people care about, and need an opinion by the rest of their followers. 
This feature by Twitter will help people be clear about what the people online actually think about a particular piece of information. This will act as a decision maker to know the public opinion about various topics. People can make use of this feature to a great extent to engage with the rest of the Twitteratis out there virtually. (ALSO READ: Twitter to break 140-character limit as part of new reforms) Coming soon! We’re rolling out the ability for everyone to create polls on Twitter: https://t.co/fEYtCjFmR6 https://t.co/4l2gofSD4I 
— Twitter India (@TwitterIndia) October 23, 2015 

The Twitter polls will enable people to cast their vote and share their opinion about something to a larger base of audience. Earlier people on Twitter used to indulge in voting by retweeting and using hashtags to tweet about something. But with the Twitter polls it will be easy and also efficiently practical to cast vote via the online polls. The compose box of the online Twitter poll will be available live to the people for a span of 24 hours. Twitter will be rolling out this particular feature on iOS, Android as well as on the desktop. Are you excited about the brand new addition to the micro blogging site?
